prompt: P > Q > R > S. Which is true?
explanation: P > Q > R > S means P is greatest. P > S is true.

prompt: A ≥ B = C > D. Which is definitely true?
explanation: A ≥ B = C > D. So A ≥ C > D. Thus A > D definitely.

prompt: M < N ≤ O = P. Which is true?
explanation: M < N ≤ O = P. So M < N ≤ P. Thus M < P.

prompt: X ≥ Y > Z, Z ≥ W. Which is true?
explanation: X ≥ Y > Z ≥ W. So X > W.

prompt: A > B, B ≥ C, C = D. Conclusions: I. A > D II. B ≥ D
explanation: A > B ≥ C = D. So A > D and B ≥ D. Both true.

prompt: P ≤ Q < R, R ≤ S. Which is false?
explanation: P ≤ Q < R ≤ S. So P < S. S < P is false.

prompt: L > M = N < O. Conclusions: I. L > N II. O > M
explanation: L > M = N. So L > N (I). N < O, M = N, so O > M (II). Both true.

prompt: A ≥ B > C, D ≥ C. Conclusions: I. A > D II. D ≤ B
explanation: A-D and B-D relations not determined. Neither definite.

prompt: J < K ≤ L > M. Which is true?
explanation: J < K ≤ L. So J < L is definite.

prompt: P = Q ≥ R > S. Conclusions: I. P > S II. Q ≥ S
explanation: P = Q ≥ R > S. So P > S (I) and Q > S (II). Both true.

prompt: A < B ≤ C < D. Which is definitely true?
explanation: A < B ≤ C < D. Chain shows A < D.

prompt: M ≥ N > O = P ≤ Q. Conclusions: I. M > P II. N ≥ Q
explanation: M ≥ N > O = P. So M > P (I). N and Q not directly comparable (II uncertain).

prompt: X ≤ Y = Z ≥ W. Which is true?
explanation: X ≤ Y = Z. So X ≤ Z.

prompt: A > B ≥ C > D, E < D. Conclusions: I. A > E II. C > E
explanation: A > B ≥ C > D > E. So A > E and C > E. Both true.

prompt: P ≥ Q, Q > R, R ≥ S. Which is true?
explanation: P ≥ Q > R ≥ S. So P > S.
